trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomized controll trial of Phyto-Soya Vaginal Gel for the relief of memopausal Vaginal Atrophy

interventions.interventions: Intervention group would be women randomised into a group that will receive the Phy-Soya Vaginal Gel and
interventions.comparator: the control group would be include women randomised into a group that will receive the placebo.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To evaluate the efficacy of Phyto-Soya vaginal gel in decreasing the severity of vaginal dryness of postmenopausal women by measuring symptoms questionnaires
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At weeks 4 and week 8 of the treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To evaluate the efficacy of Phyto-Soya vaginal gel in decreasing the severity of vaginal/vulval itching of postmenopausal women by measuring symptoms questionnaires
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At weeks 4 and week 8 of the treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To evaluate the efficacy of Phyto-Soya vaginal gel in decreasing the severity of dyspareunia of postmenopausal women by measuring symptoms questionnaires
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At weeks 4 and week 8 of the treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Measuring vaginal pH and vaginal Maturation Index
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At 4 weeks and 8 weeks of the treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Postmenopausal woman and one of the following:Vaginal dryness, vaginal itching, Painful sexual intercourse, Vaginal pH >5 at screening.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Systemic or topical oestrogens within 8 weeks. effective menopausal herbals within 4 weeks, Vulval dystrophy, Current vaginal or urinary tract infection, Any vaginal surgery within 12 months.

contact.name: Ms Jinzhu Liu
contact.address: Sydney Menopause Centre Royal Hospital for Women Level 0 Barker Street Randwick NSW 2031

contact.name: Associate Professor John Eden
contact.address: Sydney Menopause Centre Royal Hospital for Women Level 0 Barker Street Randwick NSW 2031
